slovak.jText1: Byť Bohom znamená mať jedinečné božské vlastnosti, ktoré nemá žiadna stvorená bytosť. Božie Slovo vymedzuje rôzne oblasti, ktoré prislúchajú len Bohu a ktoré má človek zakázané prisudzovať ktorejkoľvek stvorenej bytosti.
slovak.jVerse1: Na počiatku stvoril Boh nebo a zem.
slovak.jVerse2: Ním (Slovom, ktoré sa stalo telom) povstalo všetko a bez Neho nepovstalo nič, čo povstalo.
slovak.jVerse3: Bolo vo svete a svet Ním povstal, ale svet Ho nepoznal. Do svojho vlastného prišiel, a Jeho vlastní Ho neprijali.
slovak.jText2: Svet Ježišom povstal, bol Ním stvorený.
slovak.jVerse4: A Otec ani nesúdi nikoho, ale celý súd odovzdal Synovi, aby všetci ctili Syna tak, ako ctia Otca.
slovak.jVersex5: Lebo nesmieš sa klaňať inému bohu, pretože Hospodin, ktorého meno je Žiarlivý, je naozaj žiarlivý Boh.
slovak.jVersexx5: A Otec ani nesúdi nikoho, ale celý súd odovzdal Synovi, aby všetci ctili Syna tak, ako ctia Otca. Kto nectí Syna, nectí ani Otca, ktorý Ho poslal.
slovak.jText5: Máme vzdať česť a slávu Ježišovi, inak si nectíme Boha.
slovak.jSub5: Len Bohu sa má klaňať Jeho stvorenie
slovak.jVerse5: Keď som to počul a videl, padol som k nohám anjelovi, ktorý mi to ukázal, a klaňal som sa mu. On mi však povedal: Pozri, nie tak! Som spoluslužobníkom tvojím, tvojich bratov, prorokov a tých, ktorí zachovávajú slová tejto knihy. Bohu sa klaňaj!
slovak.jVerse6: A keď zase uvedie Prvorodeného na svet, hovorí: Nech padnú pred Ním na kolená všetci anjeli Boží!
slovak.jText6: Božie stvorenie sa má klaňať Ježišovi.
slovak.jSub6: Len Boh môže vládnuť nad všetkým
slovak.jVerse7: Najvyšší vládne nad kráľovstvom ľudí a dáva ho, komu chce.
slovak.jVerse8: Ježiš pristúpil a povedal im: „Daná mi je všetka moc na nebi aj na zemi.
slovak.jVerse9: O toľko je dôstojnejší ako anjeli, o koľko ich prevyšuje menom, ktoré zdedil. Veď kedy ktorému anjelovi povedal Boh: Syn môj si Ty, ja som ťa splodil dnes? A inde: Ja Mu budem otcom a On mi bude synom.
slovak.jVerse10: Lebo nie anjelom podriadil Boh budúci svet, o ktorom hovoríme.
slovak.jSub8: Prorok Izaiáš ho predpovedá ako Boha
slovak.jVerse11: Lebo dieťa sa nám narodilo, syn nám je daný; na jeho pleciach spočinie kniežatstvo, jeho meno bude: Predivný radca, Mocný Boh, Otec večnosti, Knieža pokoja.
slovak.jSub9: Slovo, ktoré sa stalo telom je Boh
slovak.jVerse12: Na počiatku bolo Slovo a Slovo bolo u Boha a Boh bol to Slovo.
slovak.jText8: Grécky originál označuje Boha slovom theón a theós: “Ἐν ἀρχῇ ἦν ὁ λόγος, καὶ ὁ λόγος ἦν πρὸς τὸν θεόν (theón), καὶ θεὸς (theós) ἦν ὁ λόγος.”
slovak.jVerse13: A to Slovo stalo sa telom, prebývalo medzi nami, a my sme hľadeli na Jeho slávu ako na slávu jednorodeného od Otca, (bolo) plné milosti a pravdy.
slovak.jText9: Ježiš prišiel v tele na svet, takže On je tým Slovom.
slovak.jVerse14: Boh riekol Mojžišovi: SOM, KTORÝ SOM. Riekol ďalej: Tak povedz Izraelcom: Poslal ma k vám SOM.
slovak.jVerse15: Hovorím vám to už teraz, skôr, ako sa to stane, aby ste uverili, keď sa to stane, že ja SOM.
slovak.jVerse16: Ježiš im riekol: Veru, veru, hovorím vám: Skôr, ako bol Abrahám, ja SOM.
slovak.jVerse17: Preto som vám povedal, že umriete v hriechoch, lebo ak neuveríte, že ja SOM, umriete v hriechoch.
slovak.jSub11: Učeník dosvedčuje, že Ježiš je Boh
slovak.jVerse18: A prišiel Ježiš, hoci dvere boli zatvorené, a postaviac sa do prostriedku, riekol im: Pokoj vám! Potom hovorí Tomášovi: Daj sem prst a pozri sa na moje ruky; daj sem ruku a vlož ju do môjho boku a nebuď neveriaci, ale veriaci. Tomáš mu povedal: Pán môj a Boh môj!
slovak.jSub12: Pavol apoštol označuje Ježiša za Boha
slovak.jVerse19: Ich sú otcovia a z nich je Kristus podľa tela, Boh nad všetkým, požehnaný naveky.
slovak.jText10: Rovnako aj grécky originál nerozdeľuje túto vetu na dve, ale pokračuje v nej čiarkou pred slovom Boh (theós) bez prerušenia: “ὧν οἱ πατέρες, καὶ ἐξ ὧν ὁ χριστὸς τὸ κατὰ σάρκα, ὁ ὢν ἐπὶ πάντων, θεὸς (theós) εὐλογητὸς εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας· ἀμήν.”
slovak.jSub13: Sám Boh oslovuje Ježiša ako Boha
slovak.jVerse20: Ale k Synovi (Boh hovorí): Tvoj trón, ó Bože, je naveky vekov a: žezlo spravodlivosti je žezlom Jeho kráľovstva; miloval si spravodlivosť a nenávidel si neprávosť; preto pomazal Ťa, ó Bože, Tvoj Boh olejom veselia nad Tvojich druhov.

english.jText1: To be God is to have unique divine properties that no other created being possesses. God's Word defines various areas that belong to God alone and that man is forbidden to attribute to any created being.
english.jVerse1: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.
english.jVerse2: Through Him all things were made, and without Him nothing was made that has been made.
english.jVerse3: He was in the world, and though the world was made through Him, the world did not recognize Him. He came to His own, and His own did not receive Him.
english.jText2: The world arose through Jesus, was created by Him.
english.jSub4: We are to worship only God
english.jVersex5: For you must not worship any other god, for the Lord, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.
english.jVersexx5: Furthermore, the Father judges no one, but has assigned all judgment to the Son, so that all may honor the Son just as they honor the Father. Whoever does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent Him.
english.jText5: We are to give honor and glory to Jesus, otherwise we are not honoring God.
english.jSub5: Creation is to bow down just before God alone
english.jVerse5: And I am John, who heard and saw these things. And when I had heard and seen them, I fell down to bow down at the feet of the angel who had shown me these things. But he said to me, “Do not do that! I am a fellow servant with you and your brothers the prophets, and with those who keep the words of this book. Bow before God!”
english.jVerse6: And again, when God brings His firstborn into the world, He says: “Let all God’s angels bow down before Him.”
english.jText6: God's creation is to worship Jesus.
english.jSub6: Only God can rule over everything
english.jVerse7: The Most High rules over the kingdom of mankind and gives it to whom He wishes.
english.jVerse8: Then Jesus came to them and said, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to Me.”
english.jText7: God entrusted all the reign to Jesus.
english.jVerse9: So He became as far superior to the angels as the name He has inherited is excellent beyond theirs. 5For to which of the angels did God ever say: “You are My Son; today I have become Your Father”? Or again: “I will be His Father, and He will be My Son.”
english.jVerse10: For it is not to angels that He has subjected the world to come, about which we are speaking.
english.jSub8: The prophet Isaiah predicts Him as God
english.jVerse11: For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given, and the government will be upon His shoulders. And He will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.
english.jSub9: The Word that became flesh is God
english.jVerse12: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
english.jText8: Greek original refers to God with the word theón and theós: “Ἐν ἀρχῇ ἦν ὁ λόγος, καὶ ὁ λόγος ἦν πρὸς τὸν θεόν (theón), καὶ θεὸς (theós) ἦν ὁ λόγος.”
english.jVerse13: The Word became flesh and made His dwelling among us. We have seen His glory, the glory of the one and only Son  from the Father, full of grace and truth.
english.jText9: Jesus came into the world in the flesh, so He is that Word.
english.jVerse14: God said to Moses, “I AM WHO I AM. This is what you are to say to the Israelites: ‘I AM has sent me to you.’”
english.jVerse15: I am telling you now before it happens, so that when it comes to pass, you will believe that I AM (He).
english.jVerse16: “Truly, truly, I tell you,” Jesus declared, “before Abraham was born, I AM!”
english.jVerse17: That is why I told you that you would die in your sins. For unless you believe that I AM (He), you will die in your sins.
english.jSub11: The disciple testifies that Jesus is God
english.jVerse18: Eight days later, His disciples were once again inside with the doors locked, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came and stood among them and said, “Peace be with you.” Then Jesus said to Thomas, “Put your finger here and look at My hands. Reach out your hand and put it into My side. Stop doubting and believe.” Thomas replied, “My Lord and my God!”
english.jSub12: Paul the apostle refers to Jesus as God
english.jVerse19: Theirs are the patriarchs, and from them proceeds the human descent of Christ, who is God over all, forever worthy of praise!
english.jText10: Likewise, the Greek original does not divide this sentence into two, but continues it with a comma before the word God (theós) without interruption: “ὧν οἱ πατέρες, καὶ ἐξ ὧν ὁ χριστὸς τὸ κατὰ σάρκα, ὁ ὢν ἐπὶ πάντων, θεὸς (theós) εὐλογητὸς εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας· ἀμήν.”
english.jSub13: God Himself addresses Jesus as God
english.jVerse20: But about the Son He (God) says: “Your throne, O God, endures forever and ever, and justice is the scepter of Your kingdom. You have loved righteousness and hated wickedness; therefore God, Your God, has anointed You above Your companions with the oil of joy.”
